Patient 34: Patient 34 is an 85-year-old male with a history of atrial fibrillation and heart failure. He is on a complex medication regimen including warfarin, metoprolol, and furosemide. His medical history is complicated by a previous stroke, which necessitates careful anticoagulation management. He has a documented allergy to penicillin. His family history is unclear, as he was adopted and has limited information about his biological relatives.
